questions.question_text: Which of the following is MOST important to include when reporting the effectiveness of risk management to senior management?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Changes in residual risk levels against acceptable levels.
Keywords are senior management and residual risk.

Selected Answer: D

D. Changes in residual risk levels against acceptable levels

When reporting the effectiveness of risk management to senior management, it is most important to include changes in residual risk levels against acceptable levels. This information helps senior management understand how well the risk management efforts are performing in terms of keeping risks within the acceptable range, which is crucial for strategic decision-making and resource allocation.

C. Risk assessment

A risk assessment is the best approach for selecting controls to minimize risk because it involves identifying, analyzing, and evaluating potential risks to an organization's assets. By understanding the risks faced by an organization, it becomes possible to prioritize and select controls that are most effective in reducing those risks. While industry best practices, cost-benefit analysis, and control-effectiveness evaluations are important considerations in selecting controls, they are typically more effective when informed by the results of a comprehensive risk assessment.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the BEST approach for selecting controls to minimize risk?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Since scalability ensures that a monitoring tool can handle enterprise growth, the best answer is:
✅ A. Scalability

Selected Answer: A
Scalability is the ability of a system or tool to grow and adapt to the changing needs of an enterprise. This means that as the enterprise grows, the monitoring tool can also grow and adapt to accommodate the increased data and usage. This allows the organization to continue to use the same monitoring tool without needing to replace it with a new one that can handle the increased data and usage.
Customizability refers to the ability of the tool to be customized to the specific needs of the enterprise, sustainability refers to the ability of the tool to be used over an extended period of time, and impact on performance refers to the effect of the tool on the performance of the enterprise.
The aspect of scalability is the most important aspect that ensures that the monitoring tool has the ability to keep up with the growth of an enterprise.
A: Scalability is definitely the right answer.
A Scalability
